channel.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help

item.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help
item.dc:creator: @kripz kripz
item.description:
@kripz wrote:

Your problem is that you don't actually want to learn the basics of a language before trying to use it.
Quoted for truth.

Try

private void webBrowser1_Navigating(object sender, WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs e)
{
e.Cancel = (e.Url.ToString() == “http://www.runescape.com/”);
}

Read full topic

item.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help
item.dc:creator: @Exernet Exernet
item.description:
@Exernet wrote:

private void webBrowser1_Navigating(object sender, WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs e) {
   if (e.Url.ToString() = "http://www.runescape.com/") {
      e.Cancel = true;
   }
}

It probably isn’t redirecting because the url returned when redirected is “http://www.runescape.com/”. You missed a slash.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

WoW sucks:

Thanks, but all i need is the little bit of code. I don’t really want to learn that just yet.

Lol… seriously.

Perhaps try:

if (e.Url.Equals("http://www.runescape.com"))

or

if (e.Url.ToString().Equals("http://www.runescape.com"))

Read full topic

item.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help
item.dc:creator: @KryptoN KryptoN_
item.description:
@KryptoN wrote:

I don’t know about C#, but I assume it’s similar to Java in this:

= is used to make a variable equal something
== is used to compare 2 primitives

You may want to check out http://www.csharp-station.com/Articles/ObjectClass.aspx
Under the “The Equals Method” heading.

Read full topic

item.title: Stop Re-Direction In C# Help
item.dc:creator: @WoW_sucks Dave
item.description:
@WoW_sucks wrote:

Well i need a bit of code that stops redirection in a RS client please. I have a link that is redirected by javascript and i need to stop it redirecting. I talked to someone and they told me to add this:

private void webBrowser1_Navigating(object sender, WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs e) { if (e.Url = "http://www.runescape.com") { e.Cancel = true; } }

I tried adding it, but it came up with an error. Any help please?

Ive also tried making it:

private void webBrowser1_Navigating(object sender, WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs e) { if (e.Url == "http://www.runescape.com") { e.Cancel = true; } }

And also:

private void webBrowser1_Navigating(object sender, WebBrowserNavigatingEventArgs e) { if (e.Url.ToString() = "http://www.runescape.com") { e.Cancel = true; } }

But none of those work.

Thanks.

Read full topic
